poem:
"Enigma of Art"

Ink river flows, Cusk's mind unfolds,
Instinctive shocks, stories she holds.
Effrontery articulate, each tale molds,
In motherhood's tome, life's supper in folds. 

Second nature stirs controversy's song,
In Italian memoir, right and wrong.
Unconscious brilliance, unsettling long,
A parade of words, where hearts belong.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Parade by Rachel Cusk review – a brilliant and unsettling feat One of the women in Rachel Cusk’s new novel confesses to an ability to shock that is “instinctive and unconscious”. This could double as a description of Cusk herself. To be controversial is second nature to her (think of the articulate effrontery of A Life’s Work, her book about motherhood, or The Last Supper, her fascinating memoir about living in Italy, which was nonetheless". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
